humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the patient has 'pN2a (4/15)', which means that there are metastases in 4 out of 15 assessed axillary lymph nodes. This corresponds to the N2 stage as per the AJCC staging system (New Rule 14 and New Rule 15).

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The 'pN' category in the TNM staging system refers to the involvement of regional lymph nodes. In this report, the patient has 'pN2a (4/15)', which indicates that out of the 15 examined lymph nodes, 4 were found to have metastatic cancer. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N2.
